item.title: React.js Notes
item.description: (Just some scribbled notes from a react youtube tutorial) Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ke90Tje7VS0 A react application consists of components Components are independent, isolated and resuable. Each component is a piece of UI. Every react application has at least one component - the root. React applications are represented as a tree of components. Components are usually implemented as js class that consists of a state and a render() method. The state is the data we want to display when the component is rendered The render method describes what the UI should look like.

item.title: Hello Friend
item.description: “Hello, friend?” That’s lame. Maybe I should give you a name… But that’s a slippery slope. You’re only in my head. We have to remember that… Shit. It’s actually happened. I’m talking to an imaginary person. ‚Äî Mr. Robot S01E01

item.title: Shaquille
item.description: (said: “sha¬∑kiel”) üëãüèæ I’m a Software Engineer by trade – with a Bachelors in Computer Science – currently studying for an MSc in Data Science and Machine Learning @ UCL. Some of my research interests include: Deep Reinforcement Learning Affective computing for physiological monitoring Structural bioinformatics ‚Äì protein structure/interaction prediction. Psychiatric diagnosis and treatment AI Safety & Ethics Feel free to reach out to me, I’ll try and respond within a couple days.
